title: From farm to table: Hog processing in action @UncleTimsFarm

tasks.task: Processing two 300-pound pigs for harvest and storage.
subtasks: Preparing the pigs for processing by hanging them in the cooler.
Confirming the weight of each pig to check if they met the desired size.
Deciding not to scald and scrape the pigs, opting instead for a simpler skinning process.
Processing the two pigs, noting they hung evenly with one's hind leg having an issue due to a previous mistake.

tasks.task: Grinding sausage from the processed pigs.
subtasks: Grinding the meat twice for a finer consistency and better seasoning.

tasks.task: Storing the processed meat and sausage in freezers.
subtasks: Freezing the majority of the meat from the two pigs in a 7.1 cubic foot freezer.

tasks.task: Considering the storage of additional products.
subtasks: Planning to use bones for making bone broth in addition to lard.

tasks.task: Preparing for pig harvest.

Checking the pigs' weight when they're harvested. Then, "Getting ready to go over and harvest them both." So subtask: Actually performing the harvest. Next, "We'll head over to my friends with them here and we have our own processing facility that we have built..." So moving them to the processing facility—MAINTASK: Transporting pigs to processing facility. Then, "so go ahead and get them taken care of." Got to processing them.
Processing the hogs by skinning instead of scalding.
Making sausage from the pigs.
Storing processed meat in freezer.
Collecting bones for bone broth.
1. Harvesting/transporting pigs to processing facility (MAINTASK)
subtasks: 2. Processing hogs by skinning (SUBTASK of main task)
4. Properly hanging pigs for butchering (SUBTASK, from mistake mentioned)

tasks.task: 5. Making sausage (MAINTASK)
7. Storing meat and sausage in freezer (MAINTASK)
8. Collecting bones for bone broth (MAINTASK)
